project.teaser: The overall aim of 'Source to Seas - Zero Pollution 2030 (SOS-ZEROPOL2030)' is to develop a holistic zero pollution framework which can guide the process towards achieving zero pollution in European seas by 2030. Marine contamination (including pollution) occurs as a direct...
project.objective: The overall aim of 'Source to Seas - Zero Pollution 2030 (SOS-ZEROPOL2030)' is to develop a holistic zero pollution framework which can guide the process towards achieving zero pollution in European seas by 2030. Marine contamination (including pollution) occurs as a direct result of human activities on both; land and in the marine environment; and requires urgent attention as healthy and clean seas provide numerous ecosystem services (e.g. food, oxygen production, climate regulation), which are critical for our survival and wellbeing. Given the complex and interconnected nature of marine pollution, the integration of sustainability-focused agendas and circular economy principles and practices is essential for the development of effective actions that can address its impacts. The implementation of processes and measures to reduce marine pollution will have consequences for numerous economic sectors (e.g. agriculture, fisheries, food and beverage industry, waste management, packaging industry, tourism, offshore energy) at multiple scales (local, national, regional and international), framing marine pollution as a considerable global socio-economic challenge that requires active collaboration from multiple stakeholders, across a range of geographic areas. In this context SOS-ZEROPOL2030 aims to co-design, co-produce, and co-deliver a stakeholder lead European Seas zero-pollution framework that provides practical guidance from source to sea addressing shortcomings in marine pollution management and governance. This holistic approach is based on best practice, puts emphasis on human behaviour, socioeconomics and governance; and is underpinned in knowledge about and understanding of current barriers to effective and efficient prevention, reduction, mitigation and monitoring of marine pollution in European Seas.
project.title: Source to Seas - Zero Pollution 2030 (SOS-ZEROPOL2030)

article.title: Taking a holistic approach to fight marine pollution

result.title: D6.4 Media package
result.description: GRID-Arendal will develop a library of material to facilitate project specific science communication in support of stakeholder engagement activities and project outreach to diverse project audiences and impact creation for project deliverables, which includes a dedicated media package and press releases/news stories.

result.title: D2.3 Stakeholder survey results
result.description: Part of the work undertaken in WP2 focuses on the development, delivery, and analysis of a standardised, largely quantitative survey tool to investigate public and stakeholder perceptions of the selected pollutants, priorities and barriers. The survey will provide insight into who is perceived as facilitators to action and what unintended consequences have been encountered. The survey will also include a section collecting best practice actions that will be followed up and documented further. This survey approach will provide new quantitative social data pertaining to the priority pollution issues, which will allow for multivariate statistical analysis. A comprehensive report on the survey results will be delivered as D2.3.

result.title: D6.7 Interactive narratives/story maps/project policy briefs
result.description: The project will develop a library of material to facilitate project specific science communication in support of stakeholder engagement activities and project outreach to diverse project audiences and impact creation for project deliverables, which includes a total of three Interactive narratives/story maps/project policy briefs to be delivered at different intervals across the project (M12/ M24, M42), that will be made available through the project website. The policy briefs aim at providing regulators and legislators with key relevant facts and findings, as well as, messages that could support their work.

result.title: D2.1 In-depth overview of gaps between the current and desired environmental state
result.description: D2.1 will provide an overview of Zero Pollution governance in the EU including relevant legislation and policy processes (e.g. in the context of MSFD & WFD, EU Green Deal’s ambition, EU strategy for plastics in a circular economy, Regional Seas conventions, directives (e.g. SUP)) and EC communications (e.g. for sustainable blue economy, Mission Starfish). The assessment will focus on the priority pollutants selected in the SOS-ZEROPOL2030 project (nutrient input, contaminants, microplastics, underwater noise) and will identify the relevant policy targets and objectives for 2030-2050 (future goals) and the proposed environmental state (reference state). The current environmental state is mapped for the selected priority pollutants, which will allow benchmarking between the two states. Task 2.1 will produce an in-depth overview of gaps, challenges, and barriers in pollution governance (D2.1), serving as a knowledge base for the stakeholder consultations in WP2.

result.title: D2.2 Overview of the existing governance landscape and the constraints and best practices of current governance efforts to achieve zero pollution for the selected priority pollutants
result.description: D2.2 focuses on studying the existing governance landscape and identifying the constraints and best practices of current governance efforts at EU level to achieve zero pollution for the selected priority pollutants. It will identify the main policy domains within the EU related to different selected pollutants and explore how actors (including regional sea conventions and member states), through existing multi-level institutions and procedures, develop and enforce policies and regulations. Results of this work will be synthesized in this overview report.

result.title: Particles, chemicals or both? Assessing the drivers of the multidimensional toxicity of car tire rubber microplastic on early life stages of Atlantic cod

details.authors: Stefania Piarulli, Lisbet Sørensen, Laura Martínez Amat, Julia Farkas, Essa Ahsan Khan, Augustine Arukwe, Alessio Gomiero, Andy M. Booth, Tânia Gomes, Bjørn Henrik Hansen

result.title: D6.1 Communication and exploitation strategy and dissemination plan (Initial Plan)
result.description: This report will focus on effective knowledge and information exchange between project audiences, stakeholders, and partners to support the project’s extensive stakeholder engagement in WP2 and WP3 and to ensure that project findings and outputs reach relevant policy and decision makers, private sector organizations and industry and the public in an audience appropriate format. The strategy will include a dedicated dissemination plan, which is a live document that guides the communication and dissemination activities of the project, by identifying WP specific communication and dissemination opportunities to reach WP specific audiences (both general and specific), specifying guidelines and protocols for overall project dissemination and communication and outlining methods that ensure the project communication is accessible for target audiences.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
